ministry: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
objective: To supplement the financial needs of all landholding farmer's families so that they can procure various inputs to ensure proper crop health and yields, and to meet domestic needs.
benefit: ₹6000 per year released by the Central Government directly into the bank accounts of eligible farmers in three equal installments through Direct Benefit Transfer.

criteria: Must be an Indian citizen
Must be a landholder farmer's family
Family should own cultivable land in India

exclusions: Families with a member who is or was a constitutional post holder, or senior government official, or ministers
Serving or retired officers/employees of Central/State Govt (except Class IV/Group D employees)
Retired pensioners with monthly pension of ₹10,000 or more (excluding Class IV/Group D employees)
Families with a member who paid income tax in the last assessment year
Professional practitioners like doctors, engineers, lawyers, chartered accountants, architects registered with professional bodies and carrying out profession by undertaking practices
application_process: Eligible farmers can apply online via the official PM-KISAN portal (https://www.pmkisan.gov.in/) or through their respective state agriculture departments.

ministry: Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment
objective: Integrated development of Scheduled Castes (SC) majority villages by convergent implementation of government schemes and gap-filling funds.
benefit: Central Assistance up to ₹20,00,000 per village for gap-filling activities and access to basic services and infrastructure for dignified living.

criteria: Village must have SC majority population
Preference for villages with a population greater than 500
Selection by State Governments as per scheme guidelines

exclusions: Villages not having SC majority population
Villages already developed as per scheme standards
application_process: Villages are selected by State Governments following scheme guidelines; individuals cannot apply directly.

scheme_name: Pradhan Mantri Krishi Sinchayee Yojana: Per Drop More Crop (PMKSY-PDMC)
ministry: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
objective: Enhance water use efficiency at the farm level through micro irrigation (drip/sprinkler), improve crop productivity, and ensure access to irrigation.
benefit: Financial assistance for installation of micro irrigation systems, micro-level water storage, and water conservation activities.
features: Increase area under micro irrigation technologies
Increase crop productivity and farmer income by precision water management
Promote micro-irrigation tech in water-intensive crops (sugarcane, banana, cotton, etc.)
Encourage fertigation and efficient water-energy use
Convergence with existing schemes leveraging created water sources

criteria: Indian citizens
Farmers engaged in cultivation

application_process: Eligible farmers can apply via their State Agriculture Departments as per nodal/implementing agency guidelines.

scheme_name: Central Assistance For One Time Settlement Of Displaced Families From PoK And Chhamb Under Prime Minister's Development Package
ministry: Ministry of Home Affairs
objective: Relief and rehabilitation for displaced families from Pakistan-occupied Jammu & Kashmir (PoJK) and Chhamb, currently settled in Jammu & Kashmir, through central assistance for one-time settlement.
benefit: Rs. 5,49,692 per family via Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT) from the Central Government; Rs. 308 per family transferred by the State Government via DBT.

criteria: Indian citizen
Family must be among the 36,384 displaced families from PoJK (1947) or Chhamb (1965, 1971)
Family/head/successor/heir residing in Jammu & Kashmir

exclusions: Families not displaced from PoJK during 1947 or Chhamb during 1965/1971
Families not currently settled in Jammu & Kashmir
application_process: The claimant/head/successor/heir can apply via the nodal authority in Jammu & Kashmir; verification and benefit transfer as per guidelines.
documents_required: Proof of residence in Jammu & Kashmir

ministry: Ministry of Rural Development
objective: Provide all-weather road connectivity to eligible unconnected rural habitations and improve rural infrastructure as a strategy for poverty alleviation.
benefit: Construction of all-weather roads in eligible rural areas to connect habitations for economic, social, and health benefits; decentralized planning and quality assurance.
features: Decentralized planning for road building
Roads constructed as per Indian Road Congress and Rural Roads Manual
Three-tier quality management system
Continuous fund flow
Joint funding by Centre and State (ratio varies by region)

criteria: Unconnected habitations with population up to 500 (Census 2001) in plain areas
Population of 250+ in Special Category States (North East, J&K, Himachal Pradesh, Uttarakhand), Desert Area, or designated Backward Districts

application_process: Selection of eligible habitations by Panchayati Raj and local representatives; individuals cannot apply directly.

scheme_name: Pradhan Mantri Matsya Kisan Samridhi Sah-yojana (PM-MKSSY): COMPONENT 1B: One-Time Incentive for the Adoption of Aquaculture Insurance
ministry: Ministry of Fisheries, Animal Husbandry and Dairying
objective: Formalise the fisheries sector and incentivise fisheries-based microenterprises and entrepreneurs to access institutional finance; encourage formal credit adoption and support repayment capacity of fisheries microenterprises.
benefit: One-time incentive to eligible applicants who availed institutional credit for fisheries-related activities and have adopted aquaculture insurance.
features: Central Sector Sub-scheme under Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana
Implemented via National Fisheries Digital Platform (NFDP)
Online application and registration

criteria: Fisheries microenterprise or individual engaged in fisheries/aquaculture-related activities
Applicant must be registered on NFDP
Applicant must have availed institutional credit through a recognised financial institution

application_process: Applicants must apply online through National Fisheries Digital Platform (NFDP) and submit required documents as per Department of Fisheries guidelines.

scheme_name: Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana: Establishment of Backyard mini RAS Units - Haryana
ministry: Fisheries Department, Government of Haryana (Centrally Sponsored Scheme under Ministry of Fisheries, Animal Husbandry and Dairying)
objective: Promote the setup of Mini Recirculatory Aquaculture System (RAS) units to enhance fish production and create livelihood opportunities among fish farmers in Haryana.
benefit: Financial assistance in the form of subsidies to eligible beneficiaries for establishing backyard mini RAS units using various water sources (canals, rivers, springs, wells, tube wells).
features: Support for constructing Mini RAS units
Utilization of multiple surface and groundwater sources
Implementation at the state level in Haryana

criteria: Resident of Haryana
Fish farmer or individual intending to set up backyard mini RAS unit

application_process: Eligible applicants can apply through the Fisheries Department, Government of Haryana; application guidelines as per department notifications.
documents_required: Proof of engagement in fish farming or intent to set up RAS unit

ministry: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
objective: To provide financial protection and crop insurance to farmers against crop loss due to natural disasters, pests, and diseases; to stabilize farmers' income and encourage modern agricultural practices.
benefit: Insurance coverage for over 50 different crops with cost-effective premium rates. Compensation for crops damaged due to natural calamities, pests, and diseases. Coverage through network of insurance companies and banks.
features: Affordable crop insurance for all Indian farmers
Coverage of more than 50 crore farmers
Covers both kharif and rabi crops
Implemented via authorized insurance providers

criteria: Indian citizens
Farmers (cultivators or sharecroppers) of insured land

application_process: Eligible farmers/cultivators/sharecroppers can apply through banks, insurance companies, or the official PMFBY portal as per government notification.

ministry: Ministry of Fisheries, Animal Husbandry and Dairying
objective: Ecologically healthy, economically viable, and socially inclusive development of the fisheries sector through a Blue Revolution. Enhance fish production, productivity, and exports, generate employment, and ensure the welfare of fishers.
benefit: Financial support for fisheries activities, infrastructure development, post-harvest management, quality improvement, and direct/indirect employment for 55 lakh persons.
features: Central sector and centrally sponsored sub-schemes
Holistic development and welfare of the fisheries sector
Implemented pan-India, including all States and UTs
Online application and eligibility check via official portal
targets: Increase fish production to 22 million metric tons by 2024-25
Augment domestic fish consumption to 12 kg per capita
Double export earnings to ₹1,00,000 crores by 2024-25
Generate 55 lakh direct and indirect employment opportunities

criteria: Fishers, fish farmers, fish workers, fish vendors
Fisheries development corporations, SHGs, JLGs, cooperatives, federations
Entrepreneurs, private firms, Fish Farmers Producer Organizations/Companies
SC/ST/women/differently abled persons
State/UT government entities and boards
Central government entities

application_process: Applicants must check eligibility and apply through the PMMSY official portal or through their respective department/agency online or offline as per guidelines.
documents_required: Proof of occupation or participation in eligible fisheries activities

ministry: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
objective: Bridge yield gaps in crops such as rice, wheat, pulses, millets, and nutri cereals by promoting improved technologies and farm management practices.
benefit: Incentives for demonstrations (up to Rs. 9,000 per ha for sole crop, Rs. 15,000 for cropping-system based, Rs. 6,000 for coarse cereals), assistance for seed purchase (area not exceeding 2 ha each per season), supply of seed mini kits, improved farm implements, bio-pesticides, micronutrients, and bio-fertilizers.
features: Production and distribution of seeds
Cluster/Frontline Demonstrations
Supply of farm inputs and implements
Seed mini kits
Support for bio-pesticides, micronutrients, bio-fertilizers

criteria: Indian citizens
Farmers growing rice, wheat, pulses, millets, or nutri cereals
Area not exceeding 2 hectares for seed assistance per crop season

application_process: Eligible farmers can apply through State Agriculture Departments or designated channels; components and benefits determined as per DBT provisions.

ministry: Department of Horticulture, Government of Haryana
objective: Protect horticultural farmers from market price fluctuations and compensate them if they receive low prices for their produce in the market; reduce financial risk and encourage diversification in agriculture.
benefit: Compensation provided to registered farmers if the sale price of covered crops in the market falls below the protected price set by the government.
features: Covers 21 crops including Ladyfinger, Chilli, Bottle Gourd, Bitter Gourd, Cabbage, Radish, Tomato, Onion, Potato, Cauliflower, Carrot, Peas, Capsicum, Brinjal, Turmeric, Garlic, Mango, Kinnow, Guava, Litchi, Plum
Eligibility for landowner, lessee, or tenant farmers in Haryana
Financial security for horticultural produce

criteria: Landowner, lessee, or tenant farmer in Haryana
Cultivate one or more covered crops

application_process: Eligible farmers can apply via the Department of Horticulture, Haryana, as per the notified process.

ministry: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
objective: Provide comprehensive insurance coverage and financial support to farmers against crop loss due to natural calamities, pests, and diseases; encourage the stability of farm incomes and adoption of modern agricultural practices.
benefit: Insurance for food crops, oilseeds, and selected commercial/horticultural crops; subsidized premiums for small and marginal farmers; claim settlement through direct bank transfer.
features: Protection against crop losses due to drought, flood, hailstorm, cyclone, pests, and diseases
Coverage for sowing/planting risk, standing crop losses, post-harvest losses due to specified perils, and localized losses like hailstorms/landslides
Available across notified areas and seasons

criteria: Indian farmers cultivating notified crops in insured areas
Small and marginal farmers eligible for subsidized premium rates

application_process: Eligible farmers can apply through local agriculture offices, insurance companies, or notified channels; report losses within 48 hours for assessment.

scheme_name: Development Support for Coffee in Traditional Areas: Water Augmentation
ministry: Ministry of Commerce and Industry
objective: Improve the production and productivity of coffee plantations by encouraging water augmentation (irrigation and water management) in traditional coffee-growing regions.
benefit: Subsidy and development support provided to eligible stakeholders for water augmentation activities in coffee plantations.
features: Sub-component of Integrated Coffee Development Project (Medium Term Framework)
Administered by Coffee Board, Department of Commerce
Promotes improved irrigation in traditional coffee areas

criteria: Individual coffee grower
Joint coffee owner
Family members growing coffee together
Stakeholder in traditional coffee growing region

application_process: Eligible applicants (coffee growers/owners) may apply to the Coffee Board as per notified scheme guidelines.

scheme_name: SVAMITVA Yojana (Survey of Villages and Mapping with Improvised Technology in Village Areas)
ministry: Ministry of Panchayati Raj
objective: To establish clear ownership of property in rural inhabited (Abadi) areas by mapping land parcels using drone technology and providing legal ownership cards (Property cards/Title deeds) to property owners. To create accurate land records, enable financial stability, and inform rural planning.
benefit: Issuance of legal ownership cards (Property cards/Title deeds) to rural land/property owners; creation of survey infrastructure and GIS maps to support rural development planning and determine property tax.
features: Covers 6.62 lakh villages over five years
Drone technology for land parcel mapping
Central Sector scheme

criteria: Resident of rural area
Possess property in rural abadi area

application_process: Eligible rural residents can apply for property mapping and ownership card via the Gram Panchayat or designated authorities as per SVAMITVA guidelines.
documents_required: Proof of property ownership in rural abadi area

ministry: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
objective: Create a pan-India electronic trading portal integrating existing APMC mandis into one unified online marketplace, promoting 'One Nation One Market' for agricultural commodities.
benefit: Single-window online platform for agricultural trade, commodity arrivals, quality assaying, e-bidding, and direct e-payment to farmers. Enhances transparency, efficiency, price discovery, and market access for sellers and buyers.
features: Digital integration of mandis across India
AI-based quality assaying system
E-bidding and online payments for efficiency
Standardized marketing and transaction procedures
Integrated more than 1,000 mandis nationwide

criteria: State Governments/UT Administrations for mandi integration
Farmers, traders, buyers registered with integrated APMC mandis

application_process: Eligible farmers, traders, and buyers must register online through the e-NAM platform or participating APMC mandis as per guidelines.

ministry: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
objective: Promote agricultural development by providing extension and advisory services to farmers, supplement public extension, and generate self-employment for agricultural graduates and allied subject holders.
benefit: Start-up training and special loans for eligible agricultural and allied graduates to set up agri-clinics/agri-business centers that offer paid or free services to farmers, such as agricultural advice, input supply, veterinary care, soil and water testing labs, pesticide units, seed processing units, farm equipment hire centres, and marketing services.
features: Implemented by National Bank for Agriculture and Rural Development (NABARD)
Start-up training and business support for self-employment
Loans available for successful trainees
Extension and advisory services across a wide range of agricultural activities

criteria: Unemployed graduates in Agriculture
Unemployed graduates in Horticulture
Unemployed graduates in Sericulture
Unemployed graduates in Veterinary Sciences
Unemployed graduates in Forestry
Unemployed graduates in Dairy Technology
Unemployed graduates in Poultry Production
Unemployed graduates in Fisheries
Diploma holders in Agriculture and allied subjects
Intermediates with Postgraduate degrees in agribusiness/agricultural biological sciences
Age between 18 and 60 years

application_process: Eligible candidates apply for training and loan assistance through the scheme portal and designated nodal agencies as per guidelines.
documents_required: If Aadhaar not assigned: Aadhaar enrolment ID slip or Copy of request for Aadhaar enrolment and Voter Identity Card or PAN or Passport or Ration Card or Employee Government ID or Passbook of Bank/Post Office or MGNREGS Card or Kisan Photo Passport or Driving Licence or any other document as specified by State/UT

ministry: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
objective: Support postgraduate education at IARI by awarding scholarships to meritorious students in M.Sc. and Ph.D. courses, strengthen agricultural research and education.
benefit: Institute scholarship for M.Sc. students (up to 2 years, extendable to 3 years and 3 months in exceptional cases for SC/ST/PC and up to one additional year for introductory courses), and Ph.D. students (up to 3 years, extendable to 4 years and 6 months for SC/ST/PC). Continuation subject to maintaining OGPA of minimum 6.00 out of 10.00 after 3rd trimester.
features: Awarded by Dean and Joint Director (Education) based on Standing Committee recommendation
Renewal based on academic performance and attendance
Only available for periods of residence and valid attendance in Post Graduate Hostels and concerned divisions

criteria: At least 21 years of age as of 31st July in year of admission
Admission and continuing performance at IARI Post Graduate School
Maintaining minimum OGPA requirement

application_process: Apply through IARI's postgraduate selection process; awards made at admission and reviewed every academic year as per merit and academic progress.
documents_required: Admission offer and academic performance record
Attendance record at Post Graduate Hostel

scheme_name: Establishment of Entrepreneur for Breed Development in Small Ruminant Sector (Sheep and Goat Farming)
ministry: Ministry of Fisheries, Animal Husbandry and Dairying
objective: Develop entrepreneurs for sustainable and integrated business models in rural sheep and goat farming, incentivize stakeholders for breed development, and convert the small ruminant sector from unorganized to organized.
benefit: Financial assistance for setting up sheep and goat breeding units with a minimum of 500 females and 25 males using high genetic variety breeds for milk, meat, and wool. Support for establishing forward and backward linkages, scientific rearing, and stall feeding models.
features: Promotion of scientific sheep and goat rearing and disease prevention
Encouragement of stall feeding model
Integrated approach for production and market linkages
Eligible breeds selected from official guidelines or in consultation with State Government
Minimum unit size: 500 females, 25 males
Available for individual entrepreneurs, Farmer Producer Organizations (FPO), Farmer Cooperatives (FCO), Self-Help Groups (SHG), Joint Liability Groups (JLG), and Section 8 Companies

criteria: Individual entrepreneur
Farmer Producer Organization (FPO)
Farmer Cooperative (FCO)
Self-Help Group (SHG)
Joint Liability Group (JLG)
Section 8 Company
Minimum capacity: 500 female sheep/goats and 25 male sheep/goats

application_process: Applicants must apply as per the National Livestock Mission guidelines through the Department of Animal Husbandry & Dairying; breed list and establishment procedures to be followed with State Government consultation.
documents_required: Proof of entity registration (individual, FPO, FCO, SHG, JLG, Section 8 Company)
Proof of land/space for the unit
Identity proof (Aadhaar, Voter ID, PAN, passport, etc.)

scheme_name: Integrated Horticulture Development Plan Scheme for Scheduled Caste Families
ministry: Department of Horticulture, Government of Haryana
objective: Encourage Scheduled Caste (SC) farmers to take up horticultural crops as a diversification option.
Acquaint SC farmers with the latest technologies in horticulture.
Increase the income of SC families by adopting various horticultural crops and improving output.
benefit: Quality planting materials and inputs for mushroom cultivation, bamboo stacking for vegetables, and protected cultivation with a subsidy of up to 90%. Training provided on horticulture practices.
features: Targeted at SC farmers with small landholdings in Haryana.
Promotes mushroom cultivation and vegetable farming.
Provides training, technical guidance, and modern technologies for horticulture diversification.

criteria: Scheduled Caste farmer
Small landholding in Haryana

application_process: Eligible SC farmers apply via the Department of Horticulture, Haryana. Follow notifications and guidelines issued by the department.
documents_required: Identity proof (Aadhaar, Voter ID, PAN, Passport)

scheme_name: Prime Minister's Rural Development Fellows Scheme (PMRDFS)
ministry: Ministry of Rural Development
objective: Provide structured learning and hands-on professional experience in rural development and poverty reduction.
Offer short-term work opportunities for young women and men with academic or professional expertise to support district administration.
benefit: Selected Fellows act as Development Facilitators, participate in district administration, assist in programme delivery to marginalized communities, and pursue a post-graduate degree in Development Practice through distance learning and contact sessions.
features: Opportunity for professional and academic growth in rural development
Participation in backward districts with exposure to governance challenges
Contribution to bridging developmental and governance deficits

criteria: Young women and men with academic or professional expertise relevant to rural development
Applicants must possess qualifications allowing contribution to district-level programme delivery

exclusions: Applicants without relevant academic or professional expertise
application_process: Apply through notifications released by the Department of Rural Development; selection based on merit and relevance of experience.
documents_required: Identity proof (Aadhaar card, Voter ID, PAN, Passport)
